Aires Marines Protegées (AMP)

title.narrative: Etude dImpact Env et Social du projet AMP Djibouti version finale

description.narrative: Etablir une gestion efficace des Aires Marines Protégées (AMP)
seat of a first-order administrative division
island
land-tied island
Energy - policy, planning and administration
Establish an efficient management scheme for the marine protected areas (MPA) of Djibouti.
A Surface of 27,500 ha of MPA is efficiently managed.

comment.narrative: No management of MPAs
All MPAs efficiently managed.

For the reporting period two training activities on navigation and security have been initiated and completed In total 15 eco-gardes and 3 project sites managers have been trained to acquire best practices in managing MPA .
Two technical workshops were organised for the construction of an anchorage buoy network in Arta plage and Seven Brothers.
Two workshops were organised with the ecogardes of Arta and Seven Brothers for the monitoring of sea turtle nesting and coral reefs.
Two workshops on waste management were conducted which included the installation of 4 toxic waste management containers at the MPAs of Seven Brothers and Arta plage with the aim of raising awareness and evaluating the volumes of waste produced. A workshop and interview process for fishermen was produced at the Seven brother MPA. A series of sensitization mission undertaken in 2014 and also 2015 by the project team has boosted the implication of communities and raised their interest vis-Ã -vis the project activities. KAI has also provided technical assistance and support in the area raising awareness and the development of Marine Protected Area Management Plans, monitoring plans and communication strategy. These plans must be validated by the national authority. KAIMarine has also helped in the organization of a trip to sensitize ambassadors on marine resources protection and on the importance of project for Djibouti Over the years we have witnessed a gradual rise in interest in MPA, however more capacity building is needed to put in place a functional organizational framework that will enable smooth management of MPA.
The Communication Strategy, of which a first design, roadmap and draft materials was presented by KAI Marine in March 2014, was launched with a series of events at the national level (PR visit to MPAs and TV) and at the international level through social networks and international conferences (IUCN WPC, East Africa ERO Summit, CBD, +).
Meetings were held with diving centres and the security sector (EU and USA).
KAI Marine has furthermore focused on two high priority lines of action; a) establishement of cooperation with the DG of Maritime affairs for the coordination with regards to waste management, anchorage and navigational codes for the MPAs and contingency plans for major risks associated to maritime transport at the TSS of Bab el Mandeb and the ports of Djibouti, and b) the cooperation with the DG Fisheries with regards to the new fisheries code and the “Coastal Community Resilience Project” for which a series of recommendations have been made (Anchored FAD fishing and other fishing techniques targeting pelagic species.

description.narrative: Les analyses de « Reef check » sont stabilisÃ©es

comment.narrative: Mesures de base de 2002, 2004, 2006, 2008

description.narrative: Legal and political framework of marine protected areas (MPA).
The level of institutional / political capacity development is increased from 6% to 50%

comment.narrative: Baseline of 6%
Target level of 50%

On the legal and political side, the project continued its activities of raising awareness on the need for legislation on the delimitation of MPAs. The proposed decree, approved by the Steering Committee, will set the physical delimitation of MPAs but must be still officially validated. Partnership has been fostered through regular meeting with other line ministries involved in marine resources (CERD, Maritime Affaires, and Fisheries). These meeting revealed the need to work in synergy and to ensure consistency between the technical services involved in Marine Protected Areas. This is considered to be a significant progress in coordination and a good base for dialogue and collaboration among different ministries. Still work has to be done in reviewing the present legal framework of MPA to integrate the new MPAs More ever the government must adopt officially the legal documents produced by the project. An initial analysis of the legal framework conducted by KAI Marine resulted in the identification of a priorisation of actions with regards to its completion.

description.narrative: Design, official mapping and marking of marine protected áreas (MPA).

comment.narrative: No design, oficial mapping or marking of MPAs.
Official map of MPA and markings of limits on site.

Delimitation of MPA sites has been completed. However, because of recent development new sites will be added. There is a need to review the whole situation and come with new delimitation integrating new sites that have been retained. These new sites have very important ecologicial value.

description.narrative: Efficient and economically sustainable MPA management structures at the central and local level.
The efficiency management tool (METT) increases to a normal level of around 40%

comment.narrative:
Baseline:
- Sept Freres: 17%
- Musha and Maskhali: 18%
- Haramous: 18 %
Target 40%

As in the review of 2014, the positive momentum has been kept up with regards to increasing capacity, raising of awareness and interest in relevant authorities and stakeholders. This has been achieved by more regular missions to the MPAs, the development of a Communication Plan at the national and international level and the development of concrete actions as mangrove restoration, beach cleaning, marine turtle and coral reef monitoring and the construction of waste oil recovery stations at strategic points of each MPA.
In addition, interviews and meetings with fishermen and whalewatching operators as well as well as other stakeholders has allowed considerable progress to be made with regards to the MPAs of Arta Plage and Seven Brother Islands, for which clear roadmaps for the development of management plan proposals which include concrete capacity development, monitoring, communication and sustainabillity schemes. However, major obstacles remain with regards to the other two MPAs and a potentially relevant 5th MPA in the Tadjourah or Lac de Goubet región. Equally important is the need for an in depth analysis of the legal framework for the entire programme .
Emphasis has been put on the increase of effectiveness of protected area management, it is very difficult to say has METT has been used to track and monitor progress . Overall M&E through this project has been very weak since, so tools were used and M&E practices are very weak throughout the whole administration.
The approximate METT values at this stage would be around 25-30% for the MPAs of Seven Brothers and Arta Plage and of 15-20% for the other two.

description.narrative: The economic sustainability indicator tool increases to 50%.

comment.narrative: Baseline of 0%
Target level of 50%

As in 2013/2014 reporting is difficult to measure the achievements of the Project with precision. Also the progress made in the past years at the organizational level might not yield sustainable results since staffing has been reduced by March 2015 because of budget constraints. The issue of financing of MPA has not been fully assessed as stipulated in the project objectives. KAI Marine has however included an economic sustainability plan in the framework of the MPA management Plans addressing core funding requirements and identifying potential funding and employment opportunities. Unless capacity building measures and administrative measures by the governement to allocated regular budget to the MPA, sustainablity will always be a issue.

description.narrative: Funding for the MPAs
Number of new economic and fund raising initiatives based on the sustainable use of resources at the MPAs.

comment.narrative: No initiatives.
Several new economic and fund raising initiatives based on the sustainable use of resources at the MPAs.

Very little progress has been made .on this aspect except for the discussions and dialogue with communities and government entities involved in the project. No studies have been undertaken to assess financial sustainability of AMP. KAI Marine included an economic sustainability proposal in the context of the MPA management plans focusing on the establishement of a core funding plan. This sustainability plan looks at potential sources of income and job opportunities at the level of MPA populations.
Moreover no funding available since project faced a serious co-financing issue from the government side. There are some private initiatives in MPA areas, and these must be coordinated if they materialize.

description.narrative: Directives and standards concerning responsable tourism adopted by all stakeholders.

comment.narrative: No directives and standards.
Directives and standards adopted by all stakeholders.

Progress achieved sets the ground for a more efficient integration of the tourism sector in the functioning of the MPAs, focusing on the potential and role of this sector in the monitoring, management and especially funding and job creation necessary for the economic and social sustainability of the MPAs. Several meetings and workshops have been held with the National Tourism Office with regards to their active involvement in the MPA Project and the development of their management plans. Coordination and cooperation is improving since the signing of the partnership agreement between Tourism and the Ministry of Environment. In addition a series of best practise codes and guidelines have been produced with regards to activities as whale watching, navigation, sports fishing, diving and anchoring which are essential for the ecological sustainability of tourism in the MPAs in future years.

description.narrative: Management and coordination of Project.
Creation of an MPA Programme Management Unit (UGP).

comment.narrative: No management body.
Creation of an MPA Programme Management Unit (UGP).

In 2015, staffing has been reduced. Two coordinators (UNV+ National ) and 3 project sites managers have left because of budget constraints as well as performance. However the Ministry of Environment took the initiative of designating two staff entirely responsible of the project and accountable to the Director of the DATE. This measure was taken to keep the MPA programmel operational.

description.narrative: Establishement of an evaluation and monitoring system.

comment.narrative: No evaluation or monitoring plan.
Establishement of an evaluation and monitoring system.

No monitoring and evaluation system has been established. Initially established base lines and indicators have been found inappropriate and cannot be measured. No M&E dedicated staff also.
KAI Marine has presented a new cost efficient monitoring plan adapted to the current limitations, focusing on reef, mangrove and sea turtle nesting indicators. Tthe proposed monitoring plan presented by KAI marine constitutes an integral part of the sustainabillity plan given that it consists of actions that could count on longterm core funding from international cooperation programmes.

description.narrative: Level of Project development on the basis of the workplan and anual budgets.

comment.narrative: Workplan and anual budgets.
satisfactory level of project development.
Project progess remains positive and delivery has been consistent during the life of the project.

title.narrative: Renforcement du degré de résilience à long terme face au

description.narrative: Renforcement du degré de résilience à long terme face aux crises et aux chocs

La nature récurrente de la sécheresse et les risques grandissants qu’elle présente pour les gains économiques et sociaux réalisés en République de Djibouti nécessitent certainement une aide immédiate pour sortir de la situation actuelle.

title.narrative: Projet d’Appui à la Coordination de de l’Aide

description.narrative: Projet d’Appui à la Coordination de de l’Aide (PACA)

Le « Projet d’Appui à la Coordination de l’Aide » (PACA) a pour objectif d’améliorer la coordination et l’efficacité de l’aide en République de Djibouti à travers un renforcement des capacités humaines, institutionnelles.
